summary: 17 CFR § 239.13 outlines the requirements for using Form S-3 to register securities under the Securities Act of 1933, specifying registrant eligibility and transaction types. Eligible registrants must meet criteria such as being organized under U.S. laws, having registered securities, and maintaining timely filings, while eligible transactions include primary and secondary offerings and offerings of non-convertible securities under certain conditions.
